reviews.text: Reasonably cheap (slightly under AUD100 per night) and located in amongst some famous Singaporean eateries and restaurants (apparently some people queue up around the block for the specialties). It was only a short stopover for me so did not manage to try any of the food.
reviews.title: Small Clean Rooms, Real Value!

reviews.text: We stayed there during our family vacation on June 2011. The room was small, yet it was clean, also the bathroom. The staffs were quite helpful, though not too friendly. If you plan to go to Universal Studios S'pore, they provide shuttle service from/to the hotel. The nearest MRT station was Novena, approximately 20' walking distance. But it was so close with Thomson bus stop, you can practically go to anywhere by bus. There were also several eating places near the hotel, with very low price. Overall, we were satisfied. Low cost, good location, standard service (though not excellence, it is the best you can expect with a budget hotel!).
reviews.title: Nice room, good location

reviews.text: Very small rooms and location wise also it is little away from the heartland. I generally like to taste different cuisines but singaporean food was a disappointment. The hotel is not very near to the Novena train station and you need to walk a lot or take a bus to Novena.

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel after finding a really nice deal for it on Expedia (65% of the normal price). Even though I was staying on a discount, I still got really good service. The staff was courteous, and quite helpful. The room is cozy, but comfortable. Everything is extremely clean. It should be noted, though, that the internet is quite slow and rather pricy.

reviews.text: Rooms were very clean, basic, and no-frills. I was expecting that from the reviews. The pool was surprisingly nice.

reviews.text: The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The hotel is relatively new, so for for the price it's acceptable. Unfortunately our room did not come with a window. We had to check our watches from time to time just to check if it's morning or not. If you're claustrophobic, this hotel is not for you.

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel from Jul 4th to 6th. On Jul 5th, we left hotel around 10:30am and found door of our room was fully opened when we returned to hotel around 8:30pm. We called the hotel reception immediately and they sent a staff, Paul to our room and said they’ll check the CCTV in corridor and give us a reply. Then we went out for dinner and returned to hotel around 10:00pm and asked Paul in the reception what they found. Paul restated they’ll give us a reply that night or next morning before we check out. However, no one from the hotel said sorry or apologizes to us!
reviews.title: Reasonable Price, Clean Place

reviews.text: Next morning, when we’ re checking out, the reception lady said thank you to us! They totally forgot that they’ve to give us an answer!!! We reminded the lady and she asked her mananger(I think he is) to come to us. Firstly, the manager didn’t say sorry. He just explained the chamber’s maid forgot to close the door when she’s cleaning the room and they gave her a warning letter. They’ll train their staff to avoid same issue for other guests. They should have trained their staffs the first day to avoid this kind of serious problem!!! The manager finally apologized reluctantly after we told him we’ll complain them. He also offered upgrading our room if we stay in their hotel again, but we are sure we won’t stay there again.
reviews.title: Good Value for Money
